newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ dollar ends well bid in patchy trading.
newsitem.headline: NZ dollar ends well bid in patchy trading.

text.p: The New Zealand dollar rallied on patchy trading on Monday to finish close to its highs for the day at US$0.7074/81.
On the Trade Weighted Index the kiwi closed at 67.58, up 15 basis points.
"There was some early selling that was pretty well absorbed," a currency dealer with an Auckland-based bank said.
"There was a rally up to 0.7083 which was the high," he said.
"It was a pretty well bid currency at the end of the day.
"It has been patchy -- not surprising given the time of year -- but the numbers have been reasonable. A reasonably steady trickle of business over most of the day," the dealer said.
Dealers picked the morning low of 0.7050/55 as the base for the kiwi, but said overnight it should trade in the 0.7060-90 range. -- Wellington newsroom 64 4 473 4746
